citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
* No expiration date was recorded on one bottle containing 100 mg of Ponazuril. This medication was intermingled with
other products that are currently being used at the facility and is therefore ready for use. This medication was obtained
from the attending veterinarian. Medications must be labeled with appropriate and accurate information to ensure that the
contents of the container can be known with certainty. The effectiveness and expected results could be drastically
changed or may not work as anticipated if the expiration date is unknown. The usage of any medication with an unknown
expiration date on regulated animals is not considered to be an acceptable veterinary practice and does not constitute
adequate veterinary care. The licensee must ensure that all medications used in the facility have a current expiration date
recorded. Correct by 12/7/23.

* Trash from the kennel was being placed in open, empty feed sacks. No trash container was observed during the
inspection. Open sacks of trash were being stored in the food storage area. Uncovered trash can attract pests and create
odors. Trash containers could help to minimize pest infestation, odors and reduce any disease hazards. The licensee
must ensure that trash containers in housing facilities and in food storage and food preparation areas be leak-proof and
must have tightly fitted lids on them at all times. Correct by 11/21/23.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
* No expiration date was recorded on one bottle containing 100 mg of Ponazuril. This medication was intermingled with 
other products that are currently being used at the facility and is therefore ready for use. This medication was obtained 
from the attending veterinarian.  Medications must be labeled with appropriate and accurate information to ensure that the 
contents of the container can be known with certainty. The effectiveness and expected results could be drastically 
changed or may not work as anticipated if the expiration date is unknown. The usage of any medication with an unknown 
expiration date on regulated animals is not considered to be an acceptable veterinary  practice and does not constitute 
adequate veterinary  care. The licensee must ensure that all medications used in the facility have a current expiration date 
recorded. Correct by 12/7/23. 
3.1(f) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
* Trash from the kennel was being placed in open, empty feed sacks. No trash container was observed during the 
inspection. Open sacks of trash were being stored in the food storage area. Uncovered  trash can attract pests and create 
odors. Trash containers could help to minimize pest infestation, odors and reduce any disease hazards. The licensee 
must ensure that trash containers in housing facilities and in food storage and food preparation areas be leak-proof and 
must have tightly fitted lids on them at all times. Correct by 11/21/23. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
